school: School of Education and Counseling Psychology

programs.title: Counseling
programs.description: The ideal program for a Master’s degree to advance in a current position, work in a non-licensed counseling setting, or prepare for future doctoral studies. Graduates can work in career counseling, college student services, human resources, organizational consulting, community services, health services, and other settings that do not require a license to practice.We offer four optional emphases; Correctional Psychology, Health Psychology, Latino Counseling, or LGBT Counseling.
programs.requirements:
Units: 52.5 quarter units (3 quarters equals 2 semester units)
Program Length:2 years (full-time and part-time available)
Emphasis Options: Correctional Psychology, Health Psychology, Latino Counseling, and LGBT Counseling
Start Dates: Fall, Winter, Spring, Summer
Instructional Method: On campus
programs.admission:
1. Statement of Purpose
2. Current Resumé or CV
3. One copy of official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended
4. Two letters of recommendation
5. Minimum 3.0 Undergraduate GPA

programs.title: Counseling Psychology
programs.degree: Master of Arts in Counseling Psychology
programs.description: The Master of Arts in Counseling Psychology provides an intensive 90-unit Masters program. Receive outstanding preparation to be become licensed as a Marriage and Family Therapist (MFT) or a Licensed Professional Clinical Counselor (LPCC). We offer four optional emphases; Correctional Psychology, Health Psychology, Latino Counseling, or LGBT Counseling.
programs.requirements:
Units: 90 quarter units (3 quarters equals 2 semester units)
Program Length:3 years (full-time and part-time available)
Tracks: MFT, LPCC, MFT/LPCC, and No Track
Start Dates: Fall, Winter, Spring, Summer
Emphasis Options: Correctional Psychology, Health Psychology, Latino Counseling, and LGBT Counseling
Start Dates: Fall, Winter, Spring, Summer
Instructional Method: On campus
programs.admission:
1. Statement of Purpose
2. Current Resumé or CV
3. One copy of official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended
4. Three letters of recommendation
5. Minimum 3.0 Undergraduate GPA

programs.title: Counseling
programs.degree: Master of Arts in Educational Leadership
programs.description:
Santa Clara University offers a relevant and high-quality Master of Arts in Educational Leadership degree. This degree is for individuals working in schools, and other educational organizations. The MA degree can be completed with an additional 15 quarter units beyond the Preliminary Administrative Services Credential or as a stand-alone degree program (45 quarter units). Completing an MA allows for deeper learning and expertise in educational Leadership in distinct contexts.
Our MA degree will also provide a foundational knowledge base and research skills to pursue an Ed.D. or Ph.D. degree in the future if desired.
programs.requirements: The Preliminary Administrative Service Credential Requires 30 quarter units (10 courses) to complete the program and 45 quarter units (15 courses) to complete MA in Educational Leadership degree. The PASC can be completed in 12 months and the PASC with an MA in 18 months. The administrative service Credential total cost is $18,900 and $28,350 with an MA degree.
programs.admission:
1. Statement of Purpose
2. Current Resumé or CV
3. One copy of official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended
4. Two letters of recommendation
5. Administrative Services Credential Applicants: proof of your valid California Teaching Credential and an Employment Verification Letter

programs.title: Teacher Education (Single Subject Credential)
programs.degree: Master of Arts in Teaching plus Single Subject Credential
programs.description: This credential authorizes the holder to teach the specific subject(s) named on the credential in departmentalized classes such as those in most middle schools and high schools. California teaching credentials are available in the following subject areas: English, foundational-level mathematics, mathematics, biological sciences, chemistry, geosciences, physics, social science, and world languages (Spanish).
programs.requirements:
Units: 50 quarter units
Program Length: 1 year (full-time) or 2 years (part-time)
Start Dates: Fall, Winter, or Summer
Instructional Method: On campus
programs.admission:
1. Statement of Purpose
2. Current Resumé or CV
3. One copy of official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended
4. Two letters of recommendation
5. 30 hours working with groups of youth
6. Basic and Subject-Matter Competency (Only applies to 1-Year Track Summer Applicants)

programs.title: Teacher Education (Multiple Subject Credential)
programs.degree: Master of Arts in Teaching plus Multiple Subject Credential
programs.description: This credential is primarily for those who intend to teach in elementary or middle schools where they are teaching multiple subjects in a self-contained classroom. Individuals entering the multiple subjects program must demonstrate subject matter competence through the passage of the California Subject Examination for Teachers-CSET Multiple Subjects. Students must provide subject matter competency in order to receive a student teaching placement.
programs.requirements:
Units: 56 quarter units (15 courses)
Program Length: 1.5 to 2 years; full-time/part-time
Start Dates: Fall, Winter, Spring, Summer
Instructional Method: On campus
programs.admission:
1. Statement of Purpose
2. Current Resumé or CV
3. One copy of official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended
4. Two letters of recommendation
5. 30 hours working with groups of youth
6. Basic and Subject-Matter Competency (Only applies to 1-Year Track Summer Applicants)
